title: Billy Eichner throws shade at Elton John amid The Lion King criticism
text:
Billy is not impressed (Picture: Getty)

The Lion King star Billy Eichner has thrown some epic shade Elton John’s way after the acclaimed singer called the recent The Lion King remake ‘disappointing’.

The Rocketman legend suggested that the recent movie, starring Beyonce and Donald Glover, ‘messed the music up’ and that the ‘ music in the current film didn’t have the same impact’ as the 1994 original.

In response, however, Billy – who voice Timon alongside Seth Rogen’s Pumbaa – simply took to Twitter to share an image of the Gnomeo And Juliet soundtrack, which Elton worked on, and captioned it: ‘What a beautiful score.’

Meow.

The Lion King remake featured new tracks by Beyonce including Spirit and Never Too Late, while the film also inspired a soundtrack curated by Queen Bey – who voiced Nala – called The Lion King: The Gift, featuring appearances from Donald Glover (Simba), Pharrell Williams and Wizkid.

Advertisement

Advertisement

In an interview with GQ, however, Elton lamented that the new soundtrack ‘fell out of the charts’, not having the success of the original soundtrack.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

He said: ‘I wish I’d been invited to the party more, but the creative vision for the film and its music was different this time around and I wasn’t really welcomed or treated with the same level of respect. That makes me extremely sad.’

The new Lion King, directed by Jon Favreau, was a photorealistic live-action remake of the original, with Donald Glover, Beyonce,. Seth Rogen, Chiwetel Ejiofar, Billy Eichner and John Oliver lending their voices.

While the film received mixed reviews, it was a smash at the box office, raking in over $1.6 billion (£1.2 billion) worldwide.

description: Billy Eichner voiced Timon in The Lion King remake starring Beyonce and Donald Glover.
